PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [cfe171b020](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13966/commits/cfe171b02027389e6cbab99a6cb3fbc27905c991)

#### Import changes for modified files

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ isBoundedUnder_ge_add`
`+ isBoundedUnder_ge_sum`
`+ isBoundedUnder_le_add`
`+ isBoundedUnder_le_sum`
`+ isBoundedUnder_sum`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10030497344/job/27719872104)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10030497344/job/27719872286)

Thanks!

`induction s using ...` did allow me to specify `Finset.induction_on` as the induction principle, but I could not get it to name the variables and the induction hypothesis (which is pretty annoying, since the induction hypothesis is surely needed in the proof). But `induction' s using ... with ...` just worked. This is definitely cleaner, thanks!

```suggestion
  induction s using Finset.induction_on
  case empty =>
    simp only [Finset.not_mem_empty, false_implies, implies_true, Finset.sum_empty, true_implies]
    refine ⟨0, by simp_all only [eventually_map, Pi.zero_apply, eventually_true]⟩
  case insert k₀ s k₀_notin_s ih =>
    simp only [Finset.mem_insert, forall_eq_or_imp, and_imp] at *
    intro bdd_k₀ bdd_rest
    simpa only [Finset.sum_insert k₀_notin_s] using hr _ _ bdd_k₀ (ih bdd_rest)
```
I think this is what you were looking for above.
Why do we need the `ge` version?

To prove boundedness from below of sums assuming the boundedness from below of the terms of the sums. (The `le` versions achieve the same for boundedness from _above_.) Both directions are needed to avoid junk values of, e.g., limsups and liminfs in conditionally complete lattices (e.g. the reals).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: IsBoundedUnder lemmas for addition and Finset.sum
